page.title: 04 LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content: Each year Maud has three local holidays, one in April,June and September. The June holiday, a long weekend coincides with the Village Gala Week.Each evening various events take place in the Village Hall or Pleasure Park organised by a committee of local residents. A disco is held to choose the Gala Queen, Prince and Princess. Events such as Five a side football,A Treasure Hunt,Pet Show, and Netballtake place. Saturday is Gala Day when there are side shows, Highland Dancing, A Pipe Band, Decorated Floats and a Bonny Baby Competition. An annual Service of Remembrance is held in the church and wreaths are laid by The British Legion, Girl Guides and Cub Scouts at the War Memorial.
